alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 7:56AM PST until December 05 at 6:14PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Nooksack River At Saxon Bridge affecting Whatcom County. .Heavy rain overnight and this morning is driving the South Fork Nooksack to flood stage. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Nooksack River at Saxon Bridge. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, the Nooksack River floodwaters will inundate much of the low farm lands along the river...with water over some roadways...including potentially Highway 9 north of Acme. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - At 630 a.m., the river was at 8.17 feet. - Forecast...The river is, and will continue to fluctuate near flood stage. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.8 feet on 11/28/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 400 PM PST.
